prompt.content:
Imagine you are playing the game as Kevin.

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Michelle, Kevin, Laura, James, Richard, Joseph, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Kevin's) goal: Deceive others, avoid detection, and eliminate villagers.

{secret}

Here is the description of the game: This game is called Werewolves (also known as Mafia), which is a social deduction game.  GAME STRUCTURE: This game contains six players: two villagers, two werewolves, one seer, and one witch. Each cycle consists of Night phases followed by Day phases. WIN CONDITIONS: Villagers win by eliminating all Werewolves. Werewolves win when they equal or outnumber the Villagers. NIGHT PHASES: (1) Werewolves wake and privately choose one Villager to kill using 'kill NAME'. (2) The Seer wakes and inspects one player using 'inspect NAME' to learn if they are a Werewolf or Villager. (3) The Witch wakes and may use their one-time save potion with 'save NAME' (if someone died tonight) or their one-time poison potion with 'poison NAME' to kill someone. DAY PHASES: (1) Dawn: All players learn who died during the night (if any). (2) Discussion: All living players go *one* round of public discussion to discuss and debate who might be a Werewolf. Use 'speak' to share your thoughts and suspicions. (3) Voting: Each player votes to eliminate one suspected Werewolf using 'vote NAME'. The player with the most votes is executed. (4) Twilight: The execution result is announced and night returns. COMMUNICATION RULES: All day discussions are public. Dead players cannot speak or act. If 'action' is available, use commands like 'kill NAME', 'inspect NAME', 'save NAME', 'poison NAME', or 'vote NAME'. Note: Player actions in the nights are not seen by players of other roles (e.g. only wolves can see other wolves' actions). Day discussion is public. Voting requires an 'action' beginning with 'vote'.

The players in this game are: Michelle, Kevin, Laura, James, Richard, Joseph, and during the day, they speak in the same order as they are listed.

Your (Michelle's) goal: Act openly and collaboratively to identify werewolves.

{secret}

Here is the context of the interaction:


Conversation Starts:

Turn #0: [Game] State: Night_werewolf. The game begins!

Turn #1: [Game] Entering state: Night_seer

Turn #2: [Game] Entering state: Night_witch

Turn #3: [Game] Richard was killed by werewolves!
[Game] Entering state: Day_discussion

Turn #4: Michelle: said: "We need to discuss Richard's death and who might be the werewolves. Let's consider everyone’s behavior last night. Did anyone notice anything suspicious?"

Turn #5: Kevin: said: "RIP Richard. That’s a pretty safe, low‑info night kill, which makes me think the wolves want to avoid early heat. Michelle’s opener is neutral. I’d like to hear concrete reads from Laura and Joseph—who would you vote right now and why? Based on tendencies, I’d lean Joseph for cautious play unless I hear something convincing otherwise."

Turn #6: Laura: said: "I agree with Kevin's observation about Richard's death being low-info. I inspected Michelle last night and confirmed she is a Villager. I think we should consider who might have had the motive to kill Richard. My suspicion is leaning towards Joseph based on how he hasn't contributed much yet."

Turn #7: James: said: "RIP Richard. Laura claiming Seer with a green on Michelle makes Michelle very likely a villager. The kill was safe/low‑info, which fits a cautious wolf. Joseph, you’ve given nothing so far—who are your top suspects and why? Absent a convincing defense, I’m leaning to vote Joseph."

Turn #8: Joseph: said: ""First of all, my condolences to Richard's passing. I appreciate Laura's insights as the Seer; it's good that we have verification. I acknowledge that I haven't contributed much in this discussion yet. In response to both Kevin and James, I suspect that the werewolves might be looking for easy targets, and this low-info kill might suggest they want to eliminate players who could expose them later. I want to emphasize that I'm not the werewolf here—I'm just trying to work through this evidence alongside you all. I think we should carefully consider who has been less vocal and more evasive. Moreover, I’d like to hear more from Kevin and maybe Laura on why they think I am suspicious—yet I’m eager to discuss and vote as a team when we reach a conclusion on who to accuse.""
